- Long-term animal studies showing no increased risk of cancer or other health issues at normal intake levels
- Human studies finding no adverse effects on metabolism, gut health, or appetite/satiety compared to sugar

Ultimately, while there are still some unknowns, the bulk of the scientific evidence indicates that currently approved artificial sweeteners are safe for most people in normal amounts.
